title: Pecos National Historical Park: Plan Your Visit
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit           Plan Your Visit         Pecos Mission Church NPS Photo  Stop in first at the E.E. Fogelson Visitor Center (505-757-7241), where you can pick up a trail guide, see a ten-minute movie, ask any questions you may have, and visit the excellent museum. Entrance to the park is free.  Park Hours: From Memorial Day through Labor Day are --> 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  Quick Links: Directions to the park. Guided tour schedule. Fishing seasons and information. Here are areas of history you'll learn more about when visiting:  Santa Fe Trail People of Pecos Spanish Encounters Forked Lightning Ranch Story of Archeology at the Pueblo Civil War Battle of Glorieta Pass What is the best way to visit the Civil War battlefield trail? Just ask at the Visitor Center, where rangers will provide directions to the trail along with a gate code for access.  Pecos National Historical Park is open every day except Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year's day. We look forward to seeing you at Pecos National Historical Park! Call the Visitor Center at 505-757-7241 for further information about tours or special events.   Â     South pueblo with church in distance. NPS Photo
